\verb\ - all verb properties\\\

"\
Properties - Verb objects\Changed 2006-09-14: Added verb:actions.\\
Namespace chart\The following chart describes the available namespaces and sub-namespaces of verb objects.\\\
Root.\\\
\verb\ - all verb properties\\\
\roles\ - role-specific data (such as \\"what is the list of prepositions for the 'iob' role in this verb?\\")\\\\\
Property table\[noparse]\The following table lists the properties available in a verb object. [r] should be replaced with a particular role identifier.\\\\\
\Property\\Flags\\\Description\\\\
\verb:roles:[r]:allowed\\\ \\\Whether the role is useable (allowed). \\\\
\verb:roles:[r]:required\\\\\\Whether the role is required or not.\\\\
\verb:roles:[r]:far\\\\\\Whether the role is far (proximity-requirement).\\\\
\verb:roles:[r]:armslength\\\\\\Whether it is arms-length.\\\\
\verb:roles:[r]:close\\\\\\Whether it requires close proximity.\\\\
\verb:roles:[r]:owned\\\\\\Whether it requires that it is in a person's possession.\\\\
\verb:roles:[r]:prepositions\\\\\\A string* of allowed prepositions for this role.\\\\
\verb:roles:[r]:direct\\\\\\Whether it is a direct object role.\\\\
\verb:roles:[r]:raw\\\\\Whether it is a raw role.\\\\
\verb:roles:[r]:single\\\\\Whether it can only take one target at a time.\\\\
\verb:actions\\\\\\String array of all actions in this verb.\\\\
\verb:action:*\\\\\\Action ID namespace (only settable, not gettable)\\\\
\verb:imperative\\\\\The verb imperative (command).\\\\
\verb:second\\\\\The second person view (what actor sees).\\\\
\verb:third\\\\\The third person view (what others see).\\\\
\verb:priviliged\\\\\(Note the typo) UNKNOWN\\\\
\verb:privacy\\\\\\Whether the action is invisible to witnesses (like whisper).\\\\
\verb:secrecy\\\\\\Whether the action is visible only to the actor (i.e. not even the target).\\\\
\verb:obscurity\\\\\\Whether the evoke is invisible to witnesses.\\\\
\verb:target-abstracts\\\\\\Whether the verb can target abstract details.\\\\
\verb:log-evokes\\\[deprecated]\\\Whether the evoke should be logged, e.g. for typo, bug, etc.\\\\
\verb:audible\\\\\\Does doing the action cause a noise? For future use with deafness and distant hearing.\\\\
\verb:crafting\\\[unused]\\\Is it a crafting verb?\\\\
\verb:always-make\\\\\\\\\\
\verb:connects\\\\\\Whether the verb connects through exits, such as knocking on a door is heard on the other side.\\\\
\verb:evoke-allowed\\\\\\Whether evokes are allowed with this verb.\\\\
\verb:evoke-required\\\\\\Whether an evoke is required for this verb. Like \\"say\\".\\\\
\verb:roles\\\\\\A string* of roles in this verb.\\\\
\verb:disabled\\\\\\Whether the verb is disabled.\\\\
\verb:ooc\\\\\\Whether it is an OOC verb.\\\\
\verb:raw\\\\\\Whether it is a raw verb.\\\\\\
\\[/noparse]\\\r\\n"
